meanings.sent1: The dentist had to reimplant the tooth after it fell out.
meanings.sent2: She carefully reimplanted the flower in the soil to help it grow.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to reimplant its battery but put it in backward by mistake.
meanings.sent4: After the storm, the gardener had to reimplant all the uprooted trees.
meanings.sent5: The surgeon skillfully reimplanted the damaged organ to save the patient's life.

meanings.definition: To place or insert back into its original position.
meanings.sent1: He needed to reimplant the book on the shelf where it belonged.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to reimplant the engine in the car to fix it.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful student had to reimplant the key in the lock to open the door.
meanings.sent4: The archaeologist carefully reimplanted the ancient artifact in its original spot.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut had to reimplant the loose screw to secure the spaceship.
